summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Forty-sixth Street, in the City of Seattle, from Eleventh Avenue Northwest to Fifteenth Avenue Northwest, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all manholes, catch basins, flush tanks, wyes, openings and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 783 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
